title: B1 Software Design Specification
purpose: This Software Design Specification (SDS) describes the detailed design of the B1 Application, including modules, interfaces, data handling, and system interactions. It ensures that development, testing, and maintenance follow a consistent and clearly documented design model within the SDLC framework.
scopeText: This SDS applies to all components of the B1 Application including frontend, backend services, and supporting infrastructure. It covers design decisions, interfaces, error handling, data structures, and modular breakdown.
overview: The B1 Application is designed using a modular layered architecture that separates presentation, application logic, and data access. The system emphasizes maintainability, testability, and scalability across cloud-hosted environments. This section provides a high-level overview of the system design.
designIntro: This section describes each module, its purpose, dependencies, interactions, and any special considerations for development and maintenance.
designSections: Handles login, JWT validation, session lifetime, password reset flows, and integration with the identity provider.
Central routing layer for API requests, applying request validation, throttling, and logs.
Implements all core application behaviors including validation, processing, and orchestration across system components.
Implements CRUD operations through ORM, ensures data integrity, and manages database migrations.
Client-side views built with modern frameworks; communicates with backend using secured REST endpoints.
Centralized logging handlers for audit logs, failure logs, and performance tracking.
attachmentsText: Component diagrams, sequence diagrams, API specifications, and traceability worksheets.
